fields.description:
Adding export NSS_STRICT_NOFORK=DISABLED to init script fixed the problem.

Error shown below after browsing to a vanilla install of 4.3 and centos 7.

2016-07-05 08:42:42 ERROR Error handling request
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 45, in handle
    self.handle_request(listener, req, client, addr)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gunicorn/workers/async.py", line 93, in handle_request
    respiter = self.wsgi(environ, resp.start_response)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 242, in __call__
    response = self.invoke_subrequest(request, use_tweens=True)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyramid/router.py", line 220, in invoke_subrequest
    request._process_response_callbacks(response)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyramid/request.py", line 84, in _process_response_callbacks
    callback(self, response)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pyramid_beaker/__init__.py", line 30, in session_callback
    self.persist()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Beaker-1.8.0-py2.7.egg/beaker/session.py", line 735, in persist
    self._session().save()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Beaker-1.8.0-py2.7.egg/beaker/session.py", line 595, in save
    self._create_cookie()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Beaker-1.8.0-py2.7.egg/beaker/session.py", line 609, in _create_cookie
    val = self._encrypt_data()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Beaker-1.8.0-py2.7.egg/beaker/session.py", line 273, in _encrypt_data
    return nonce + b64encode(crypto.aesEncrypt(data, encrypt_key))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Beaker-1.8.0-py2.7.egg/beaker/crypto/nsscrypto.py", line 16, in aesEncrypt
    nss.nss.CKA_ENCRYPT, nss.nss.SecItem(key))
NSPRError: (SEC_ERROR_PKCS11_DEVICE_ERROR) A PKCS #11 module returned CKR_DEVICE_ERROR, indicating that a problem has occurred with the token or slot.

fields.summary: Internal server error on fresh install of eucaconsole
fields.environment:
CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511 (Core)

comments.body:
An open bugzilla targeting nss is in "QA" here: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1317691

This might be cleared up with the fixed version of nss(nss-3.21.0-16.el7), if and when its released, but we don't know why [~jbreiding] encountered this error on a personal install, while we don't see it in EQS package installs.  I will install a vanilla centos 7 later today and see if I can reproduce.

I just tried on centos 7 images in QA. It ran fine after doing these steps:
    2  yum install http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/yum/tags/eucalyptus-devel/centos/7/x86_64/eucalyptus-release-ci-0-1.el7.noarch.rpm
    3  yum -y install eucaconsole
    4  vi /etc/eucaconsole/console.ini (set ufshost)
    5  service eucaconsole start


Linux euca-10-111-31-246 3.10.0-123.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Jun 30 12:09:22 UTC 2014 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

I just repeated the above, but first did a "yum -y update" and got the same results.

On a CentOS7 minimal install, in a VMware VM on my laptop, "yum update"d and then repeating [~dkavanagh]'s steps above, it worked fine for me. One difference from [~jbreiding]'s system is that I do not have python-nss installed, and neither do any of my EQS systems, euca or bare.

After further discussions the culprit is likely the presence of python-nss on the system where the console is installed.

According to this commit python-nss is given priority if present over pycryptopp
https://github.com/bbangert/beaker/commit/4733630c0359636f5ab8e1b2b33470c67b5ba4fc

I going to lower the priority if this is confirmed to be the cause as a simple solution is to deploy console in a vm/instance.

There would be some concern if we could not run the console on the UFS host (or perhaps, the CLC). I'll fire up a cloud in QA w/ the console on the UFS host.

I ran this setup: http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/4472/
I can access the console and login there.

It has been determined that python-nss cannot be installed on the same system with eucaconsole, as then beaker 1.8 prefers python-nss over pycryptopp.  This will be documented in a knowledgebase article via the support team.  I will provide the content and [~jcarroll] will publish it.

I will link to the KB article when it is published.
For the record, this only affects 4.3. I installed python-nss on a 4.2.2 eucaconsole with no ill effects.

Thanks to [~jcarroll] for posting this KB article.  This is the article that users will find that recommends the resolution/workaround:

https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/210311806
trying to find the known issue indicator
There is not a known issue indicator in the Resolution field.
